intro: Reholttumia hudsoniana, commonly known as the Hudson's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its production of milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It features small, inconspicuous flowers surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. Its botanical significance lies in its ecological role and its use in botanical research.
